column4: firefox 3 does not save any browse history--the back buttons, forward, and refresh buttons are greyed out at all times..
how can i fix firefox?  The back button/forward button don't work
go to help:config in the address bar and search for history and see if anything is set to 0 or false
it says the protocol (help) isn't associated
browser.history.showSessions is set false, that's the only one with history in the name
mine is set to false too so that's not the problem
close firefox and go to your home dir and move the .mozilla directory to another name then reopen firefox and it should create a new default config
when I search for history I get about 10 things in the list with various settings so a default config might fix you up
i did that already in response to the 'firefox is already running' error... and since that might have caused the problem i have now i tried moving my old profile back to the default name
don't move the profile itself to the new profile, just move the stuff you need like bookmarks etc
firefox should create a new profile when it starts up and doesn't find the mozilla dir i think
yes, but you don't want to just rename your old profile, you would go into the old profile and copy say your bookmarks.html file from the old profile to the new profile dir

i'm not concerned with any settings from my old profile because this is a rather fresh install and i didn't add bookmarks or anything yet.  The point is that I created a new profile and it didn't resolve the issue
reinstall firefox then, not sure what's up, afaik any config issues like you describe should be solved with a new profile

; k.. i really doubt it's actually a configuration issue.. just an incredibly annoying bug .  I might try grabbing source from moz's website instead of taking ubuntu's package as it seems unstable for my setup..
